CatDescriptText: Edward J. Brothers, pasteurizer, 1930 Birkwood Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 8, 1959, pg. B1 with question: "Do you believe the John James Racket Squad is driving the numbers racket out of Pittsburgh?" answer reads: "No, I honestly don't think that they are. From my own observation, I can see that it is not hard to play a number."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Edward J. Brothers wearing light colored cap, and light colored short sleeved shirt with embroidered racing flags, eyeglasses case and pens in breast pocket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, with Thrift Drugs and Kappels in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
